title: MLB optimistic Cuba will play in WBC
subtitle: MLB optimistic Cuba will play in WBC
body: SCOTTSDALE, Ariz. -- Major League Baseball's second in command said on Wednesday night that he was still "guardedly optimistic" that the U.S. Treasury Dept. will approve a reapplication for a license so Cuba can participate in the upcoming inaugural World Baseball Classic.  MLB filed the application on Dec. 22, a week after the Treasury Dept. denied the initial application, ostensibly on financial grounds, thus barring Cuba from the 16-team tournament that is currently scheduled from March 3-20 in the U.S., Japan and Puerto Rico.  "We remain guardedly optimistic and are looking forward to receiving a positive response to our application," Bob DuPuy, MLB's president and chief operating officer, said after a meeting of the executive council during the first day of owners' meetings this week. "Hopefully, in a matter of days." Barry M. Bloom is a national reporter for MLB.com. This story was not subject to the approval of Major League Baseball or its clubs.
author: Barry M. Bloom
